REVIEW: May 1 2007 	Perfect location - great for the price!	I was a bit worried about how the hotel would be but im glad i listened to all the positive reviews. It was absolutely fine! For one of the cheaper hotels in NY, we felt it had everything we needed and the location was perfect for seeing everything and a few minutes walk to the restaurants/shows in Times Square. Our Queen room on the 2nd floor was clean and spacious, with tea/coffee facilities, iron, hairdryer, and a good size bathroom. Air conditioning was a bit loud but it worked! Having free breakfast (if we wanted it) and free internet access was great! And the reception staff were very helpful and friendly (and happy to change peoples rooms if they wanted to). Couldnt really fault the place! Would definitely reccommend!

Apr 25 2007	Big for a NY hotel room!	Fantastic location - just blocks from Broadway shows, Times Square. Quite reasonable for the location. Room was clean and larger than most NY hotel rooms. I will definitely stay here again!

Apr 25 2007 	Budget hotel good location near Times Square	A block off Times Square, this is a great location for theatre goers. Plenty going on in the neighborhood. Lobby was not bad, with breakfast area, free internet and printer, exercise room. As a business traveler I was given a small bag with generous sample sizes of toiletries and snacks. Rooms were New York city small, with a small closet although a decent sized bathroom. Room had coffee maker, clock radio, and a TV that needed some adjustment. The air conditioning is supplied by a room unit that can be noisy for some, but the outflow was blocked by the drapes which were tricky to close. The staff were friendly, knowledgable. Reports of noise in other reviews did not materialize except for some door slamming. With prices sky high in Manhattan the Comfort Inn offers a reasonably priced stay although in other cities $250 would get you five star accommodations.

Apr 24 2007 	Great Location; Clean Hotel	I won't repeat what others have said about this hotel, but I highly recommend it for anyone who would like to stay near Times Square. It is a short 5 min walk from the closest subway station (both the Times Square one and the 42nd blue line which is a straight connect to the AirTrain Jamaica station). Although not a glamourous hotel, it met our basic needs. Clean room, clean bathroom, and a free continental breakfast. Really, you don't need much more when you're mostly wandering in NYC.Definitely will come back to this hotel the next time we visit NYC.

Apr 12 2007 	Really Enjoyed My Stay!	I just came back from a very nice experience at the Comfort Inn Midtown. I stayed in a standard room with a queen-size bed and had plenty of room. The room, bathroom, bed linens, et al were very clean. I was on the fourth floor in the front of the hotel, so I could hear some street noise at night, but it wasn't excessive and it didn't keep me awake.The location was FABULOUS...if you love Broadway shows, it's the best. It was right down the street from the TKTS stand and within easy walking distance of the shows.Best of all was the attitude of the staff. The check-in staff was friendly, there was a gentleman who was wonderful about little courtesies like opening the elevator when he saw you coming, and the desk staff was nice about answering questions, giving directions, etc. I loved being able to check my e-mail, and the continental breakfast in the morning was a simple but tasty way to start the day.This is a budget hotel, but I found the overall quality, services, and friendliness to be much better than other budget places where I've stayed. The Comfort Inn Midtown enhanced my trip to Manhattan, and I'll be back!

Apr 11 2007	Review from Ireland	My wife and I stayed here for four nights in March 2007 and had a most pleasant experience. We have stayed in many Comfort Inns across the States and although the rooms here are smaller the double room we got was perfectly adequate, bed was comfortable and everything was spotless. Nice touch is the goody bag on arrival. Staff most pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice and plentiful. Also very nice clientelle. Approximately 100 yds. from Times Square-you won't get better location. Also felt very safe although could say this for anywhere we visited. For a nice drink Rosie O'Gradys is two doors away and open late. It's friendly and accommodating. O'Briens across the road is much smaller, wasn't to our taste and the drink prices were steep by comparison with most bars we visited. O'Flahertys on East 46th. Street is more of an old style bar, has music every night and is worth a visit if you don't mind a bit of a walk. For good food at reasonable prices, lunch specials and very reasonable drink prices (pint of Bud for $3) try McAnnas to the left as you exit the hotel- about two blocks. Excellent fish and chips for $7.95. We absolutely loved New York and and can't wait to visit again. Would have no hesitation in staying at the Comfort again and would recommend to anyone in particular first time visitors.

Mar 23 2007 	Awsome Location	This is seriously THE BEST location that money can buy in Midtown Manhattan. We paid around $170 per night for the hotel. They also will give you a AAA discount (10% off). The Comfort Inn Midtown is less than 1/2 block from the center of Times Square. Granted, it's not a luxury hotel, but it is a clean, decent place to sleep at night. And besides, that's what a hotel is for anyways. You don't spend that much time there. The room was small, as is expected for NY. The bed is decent. There was no view, but this is also expected since Manhattan is full of skyscrapers to block the views. The plus is that there's free continental breakfast in the morning and free internet. The front desk staff was very curtious and polite. The 1/2 price ticket booth (for musicals and plays) is 1/2 block away. The hotel is also about 1 block from 5th Avenue (with all the famous shopping). Manhattan has a great subway system. The subway stop is less than 1 block away from the hotel. It's within walking distance to most of the theaters, Rockefeller Center, Macy's, We saw Doubt (a play) and it was excellent. We took the subway everywhere and saw just about everything there was to see in Manhattan.

Mar 21 2007 	I Suggest You Reconsider	Myself and my three friends decided to go for four nights and five days to New York City for spring break. As University students, we don't exactly have a lot of cash to spend on accomodations or transportation, so we decided to stay somewhere affordable and close to Times Square. Those two aspects of this hotel is pretty much where the positives end.I may be a little bit biased as I am used to travelling with my family, and we tend to stay at luxury hotels when we go away. However, I have stayed with friends at Comfort Inns before, several times actually, and I have never been as unpleasantly surprised as I was with this particular one. The room was small. When I say it was small, I mean small even by New York City standards. The two double beds were practically touching and I couldn't even pull my suitcase from one side of the room to the other. The bathroom was a tub and a sink, and it was freezing cold. The heater was a very noisy window unit and the temperature did not stay consistent.The main hallway was nice, but it is decieving. We stayed on the fourth floor, and the rooms were so close to each other that we could hear everything that was going on in the room next to us VERY clearly. On the last two nights that we were there there was a couple across the hall that seemed to be filming rather innapropriate amateur movies quite unabashadly, and with the door to their room wide open. We called the front desk, but no one did anything and the nonsense went on until about 3AM, when they finally shut their door.Room service was fine. The pillows were quite lumpy, the beds were hard and the sheets were clean, but very old and faded. We didn't have any problems with our maid service. Due to our familiarity with luxury hotels, we often lef cash sitting on the desk and bedside tables by accident, but it was always there when we returned at night.Breakfast was wonderful. it was actually oddly out of place in the otherwise budget hotel. There was fresh coffee, a cappuccino machine, bagels, muffins, several types of cereal, waffles, a toaster and fresh fruit. They also provided Red Bull free of charge every morning, which I found quite nice. I'm not a breakfast eater, but I did find myself waking up specifically so I could go down for some in the mornings.I probably would have returned to stay if I hadn't been so insulted by the manager when we checked out. The staff had, up until this point been very very friendly. The breakfast attendant did not speak any english, but he was always smiling, the maids were friendly and very accomodating, the front desk attendant was very nice and I had a good chat with him almost every night. However, the manager, a woman whose name I can't remember, was very rude. When we were checking out we noticed that there was a long distance phone call on our bill for $10. We looked up the area code and it was a call to Quebec. None of us had made a phonecall from the room, we all used our cell phones. At one point we tried to order pizza, but couldn't even get the room phone to work. Despite our best efforts, we couldn't even get the manager to care or check into it. She just kept shrugging it off and telling us we had to pay. I mean, it was only $10. We insisted on talking to someone else, but she told us there simply was no one else, and then announced that she had to go home as her shift was over.If you want something cheap and in a good location and you don't mind cramped rooms, loud noises and pornographers, you should be fine. I recommend the breakfast.

Mar 17 2007 	Great value for NYC	I will be eternally grateful to the Comfort Inn Midtown for rescuing us from the horror of the Murray Hill Inn (where we had originally booked for five nights but left after two for various reasons - refer my review for that hotel).So, maybe I was wearing rose-coloured glasses but the CIM seemed like an oasis to us! Less than one minute's walk from Times Square, and just a couple of blocks from Fifth Avenue, the location is fantastic. The complimentary breakfast is basic but fresh (bagels, juice, tea/coffee/red bull, yoghurt, cereals), and it's great to have free access to the internet. The staff on the front desk take some prompting to get their attention.Our room was very spacious by NYC standards also with a large bathroom including a bath. All very clean and tidy. The lift is small, slow and there's just one, but better than none at all. (Murray Hill Inn take note.)Highly recommended!

Mar 11 2007	Great Place to Stay!	A friend and I booked this hotel pretty last minute. We had searched for a few days to find a hotel that had a good price, a good location, and 2 double beds (most things you book online, you can't request this). I chanced upon this one, and am so glad!It's close enough to Broadway / Times Square that you can walk to all the shows, yet in enough off 6th Ave to be quiet at night. We (Two twenty-something women) felt very safe walking in the area, and to and from the hotel at night. It is also close to the subway, which we also used (though forgot a few times to watch for uptown/downtown direction...whoops!).The hotel was great. All staff were friendly and helpful, and check-in and out was done in a matter of minutes. I called the hotel directly to book and received the exact room I wanted. I then was able to recieve a 10% discount by presenting my AAA card upon arrival. This made it cheaper than anything we found online.  We stayed in room 608--request it if you are also looking for a 2 double bed room. The closet was on the small side, but we had no trouble with having enough space for the 2 of us. People complained in other reviews about having a room in the back, with a view of a building, but honestly, it was fine--we heard no noise outside! Even if you had a room at the front of the hotel, you'd only see the building across the street, and it would probably be noisy at night! You could hear people opening/closing doors in our section of the hall (7 or 8 rooms) but not so much that we were disturbed during the night.I guess if there were more than 2 people there, things could be a little tight, but it's doable. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The free breakfast was great (from 7 to 10 am), bagels, cereal, coffee, juice, yogurt, toast--helped us save a few bucks. The elevator is small, so you might have to wait to go up, but really, who cares? There are two computers, which were handy for checking show prices & mapping places we wanted to go. You might have to wait a few minutes if other guests are there, but no big deal. Hallways are narrow, as they are in many hotels. Really, it was a very decent hotel for a fabulous price. We are highly recommending it to friends and family in the future...Just a side note, if you are going to a broadway show & want cheap tickets: Many shows have last minute ticket lotteries a few hours ahead of show time. These tickets are under $30 each and are usually for the front row. You can hope your name is pulled and get 2 tix per name. However, lotteries are open for up to 30 min...and people come from nowhere to put their name in! Other shows have "rush" tickets where the first 30 or so people in line can get up to 2 tix per person. The Disney ones specify that these are for students, but others (Color Purple, Chicago, etc.) are just first come, first served; each person in line gets 2 tix. Just do a round of the ticket offices for shows you want to see; ask them what time to get there for lotteries/RUSH tix and try that first!WORTH IT TO CHECK OUT BEFORE GOING TO TKTS (which cost 60 - 100 dollars (though maybe better seats).

Feb 20 2007 	Comfort inn review	Me and my family stayed here for 5 nights in a 2 double bedded room. The room was clean and fresh towels provided everyday. The room was fairly small for 4 people but was more than sufficient considering it was only used as a base. The bathroom was fairly cold but you only use it for a short time so no real problem once the shower was used. The breakfast was more than adequate with a selection of bagels, pastries, yogurts, cereal, fruit e.t.cThe location is great and if you want a drink in the evening there was a bar (rosie o'grady) just along the road that had no problem with our 2 sons being allowed in (ages 16 and 13)So all in all a decent room for the fairly inexpensive rate and i would use them again if I ever returned to NYC

Feb 2 2007	Good experience nice people	Well, It was my first time not only in New York but in the USA and I have to say that the location of the hotel is great. Me and my boyfriend had a nice experience in this place; Its clean and the employees were really kind. We didnt had a room with a nice view, but a very quiet room (except by the heater, seems little old) We were little concerned about security, but nothing happened at the end. Basic breakfast its like that: basic, and its served in a small saloon, anyway it was clean and enough to start our walks throw New York. If I have to repeat, I will do it without doubts. The price related to the quality of the place its more than fair.

Jan 22 2007 	Loud Loud 	I stayed 3 nights at this hotel which was in a wonderful location and reasonably priced. I would never stay there again because of the noise though. The room doors are heavy and close loud and hard. I tried to respect my neighbors, but they didn't do the same for me. I was awakened constantly during the night. I stayed up until 12:30 a.m., but others around me were up later and every time someone closed their door it woke me up and shook the room. The noise would start up again around 6:30 a.m. as people left their rooms. I have never heard hotel room doors close so loudly. Waking up constantly because of this ruined this hotel for me. There were other negatives such as the room phone that worked the first day, but not the other two days. The weather was very cold while I was there, and at night I about froze in the bed. The blankets were tissue thin. I slept with a sweater over my pajamas. Unless I couldn't find it, I don't think there was any way to control the heat in the room. There was a window air conditioner, but for heat I was at the hotel's mercy. The room seemed clean until I pulled the bedsheets back at midnight on the first night and saw a semen stain. Despite all of this, I have to admit that the location was terrific and the staff that I encountered were delightful. They were all pleasant and very friendly. The bathroom was large and the water pressure great with plenty of hot water. I really liked the people that worked there, but I just wouldn't go back primarily because of the loud room doors.

Jan 22 2007 	Safe Clean and Convenient!!	My 9 year old daughter and I stayed here for 4 days last week. I was a little concerned about safety, but my mind was put at ease by the other reviews. The staff was so nice to us and really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We were even given a "goody bag" upon arrival, which was the coolest thing for my daughter! Our room was on the small side, but was large enough for 2 twin beds, a desk, entertainment center and our luggage. The bathroom was clean and even had a hair dryer, coffee maker and window shelf for all of things. The BEST thing about this hotel is the location. You are literally steps away from Times Square! We walked everywhere (Today Show, shopping on Fifth Ave. and all Broadway shows). For the price, you can not go wrong here. If you are going to New York to sit in a big expensive hotel room, then you are going for the wrong reasons!! We will stay at this location on all of our future trips and will highly recommend it to our family and friends.

Jan 9 2007 	Location Location.....	As so many of the reviews here will tell you, this hotel benefits from a superb location, just off Times Square in NYC. Literally steps away from the action and inside the New Year celebrations police cordon when we stayed there in 2006/7.Accomodation is, unfortunately, a little less glamorous. Think tired Travelodge and you'll have the idea. Our room was small (about 11 feet square) with a view of the next building. You could just about see the sky if you peered up between the buildings. Our room on the 3rd floor was quiet, even on New Years Eve, an important plus for a city centre hotel!Despite it's slightly tired appearance, the hotel had a good continental breakfast included and the desk staff were helpful and polite. Add that to complimentary gym and internet access (2 PCs) and you have a good budget package, considering the location.In short, don't expect too much and you won't be dissapointed.

Dec 19 2006 	You will enjoy value and location.	Four of us went to Manhattan in Dec of 2006. I checked Trip Advisor for reviews, and the ratings given were very reliable. The location of this hotel is perfect for Time Square area. The room was not overly small considering size of most NYC rooms. I felt that it was more than adequate for 2 people. Hotel Staff very helpful and courteous. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a room on the 7th floor front view. The other couple with us had a side room. Both rooms OK, but I believe the room with the front view had a little more room than the side room. Only one elevator in hotel, but it really was not a major problem. Breakfast room a little small, but my advice is don't be in a hurry, give yourself enough time, wait your turn for a seat and you will enjoy a typical continental breakfast for free. I have been in many hotels in NYC including Hilton New York, Rennaissance Time Square, Millenium Broadway, and rate this hotel as one I would definetely stay at again, because of value pricing.

Dec 10 2006 	Our Camera was stolen - Management Unresponsive	Based on the price we knew this would not be a luxury hotel but was just looking for something clean and safe. The room was very basic but clean. The day after we checked in my camera was stolen out of my suit case and my daughters coat pockets were gone through as well. We reported this to the manager who indicated our maid was only employed with them one week. The manager did not follow up with us as promised. We spoke with another occupant who had 2 cameras stolen from their room the same day. When they asked the hotel if any other cameras had been reported missing they were told no, which was not true. We were not advised to fill out an incident report and were discouraged from contacting the police. So for the rest of our stay we had no maid service because of concern about additional items being stolen. There is 1 ice machine and it was broken half the time we were there. Several of the hotel employees were very friendly and nice, unfortunately the theft and lack of candor and appropriate followup with the management really tainted our stay. I would not recommend staying here. The cost savings with this hotel will be spent to replace my camera that was stolen out of my suitcase.

Nov 26 2006 	More Than Just A Hotel	LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION! This is so important, but when it is coupled with great staff and excellent cleanliness it means so much more. Good continental selectional for breakfast. Our room on the 3rd floor faced a brick wall but we just kept the shades drawn , no problem as we were out all day!!Only 2 doors away from Rosie O Gradys, good food and craic (oh, by the way thats Irish for great conversation and laughter) Forgot to mention on arrival you get a welcome bag per person with lots of little goodies included, how many hotels do this??. If you book tickets for the Greyline bus at reception you get $3 off per person Will definately stay here again!!

Nov 15 2006 	Excellent location clean very comfortable professional staff	I have stayed at this hotel twice in the last 2 months. Five nights in October and four nights in November and was very impressed with this hotel. It is in a great location (steps to Times Square) and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The beds are very comfortable and the breakfast is excellent. The price and location are difficult to beat. The rooms are very clean. The staff also bend over backwards to arrange shuttles to the airport and to provide tourist information. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NYC.

Nov 13 2006 	Nice simple friendly hotel with a great location	My wife and I stayed here for one night while we were in New York to see some shows. While we didn't have to pay full price for our room due to points earned on a credit card affinity program, we would nonetheless definetely consider staying here next time we're in New York City. This hotel isn't fancy, certainly, but it has everything you would want for a comfortable stay. The front desk staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful for an establishment of this sort. The room is small, and a "real" window with a view of something beside the ventilation shaft would have been nice, but everything was extremely clean and well maintained. The bathroom was large and well-supplied. The television set, air conditioning, coffee maker, and clock radio worked fine, and seemed quite new. Indeed, the whole room seems to have been updated and refurbished faily recently. There was even an extra pillow for both of us! There was a nice complimentary continental breakfast, and an excercise room and internet room (which we did not use). For a hotel at this level, you really couldn't expect more. A great location as well; I couldn't believe how close Times Square was! The $23 special rate for overnight parking (in a very modern garage across the street) was quite reasonablr, as well, for New York (about half what it would have cost otherwise).

Nov 11 2006 	A Handy place for a visiting Manhatten	I really liked the place, abit dated in decor but it feels warm and doesnt have the sterile feel like alot of chain hotels have.The room service was good with comfy beds. Be warned of the Receptionist though, He's an anglophile - and loves all things British, constant refrences to the BBC's "keeping up apperences" made me laugh..... i would recommend this hotel.

Nov 2 2006 	Excellent location	We just returned from a five night stay at this hotel and while I was a little concerned whether it would be too basic, how wrong I was, yeah it is in need of some painting and modernisation but for that price and location you can;t go wrong. The staff were sooo nice and helpful, breakfast was plentiful, room was clean as was bathroom and of a fair size, the only concern I had was I overheard a few other guests complaining about the radiators in their room being noisy, we had no such problems thankfully. But what do you want for that price? Would stay again definitely if on a budget.

Oct 29 2006 	Good Value and Great Location	We stayed at the Hotel from the 21st Oct to 26th we were on the 6th floor and had no problems with the lift. The rooms were clean the staff helpfull and what a great location only a few yards from Times Square and lots of bars and restaurants to choose from. I would certainly stay there again and cant wait to return to NY.

Oct 27 2006	What a location!	This hotel was simple. It provided an excellent location for sightseeing, just a few paces from Times Square.The room was small, and don't expect a view. But if all you want is a clean, safe place to sleep at night, it is an excellent choice for the budget-concious traveller.The breakfast was well-stocked, with the usual selection of cereal, fruit, bread and bagels, pastries and donughts, juice, tea and coffee. Free copies of USA Today and the NY Post were available by 7am every morning.The staff were friendly and helpful without being "over the top".A great place to stay in a great location. Book it with confidence.

Oct 25 2006 	Great Location Excellent Value	We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from 21st-25th September this year. The location of the hotel is superb being only 1/2 a block from Times Square. Our room was on the 7th floor and was quite bright. The room was larger than I expected and both the room and the bathroom were spotless. There were coffee making facilities which were replenished daily and an ironing board and iron in the room. All of the staff I had dealings with were polite and friendly. The free buffet breakfast consisted of bagels, toast, pastries, doughnuts, cereal, fruit, coffee and juice, all of which was replenished constantly. There is a complimentary fitness room with 3 cardio machines and a business room with 2 computers which offer free internet and printing. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would be very happy to stay here again.Footnote: Rosie O'Grady's Steak house a couple of doors down serve excellent food in a nice atmosphere, and O'Briens Irish Bar across the road is a great place for pre dinner drinks or for a night cap - very friendly!

Oct 21 2006 	So close to Times Square A must stay at!!!	This is a nice place and i would stay there again for sure, the elevator is broken alot and as long as you ask for a room on the highest floors available you will be able to see past the comfort inn sign they have on the from of the building!!!! also, ask for a room on the front of the hotel not the back, the back looks out onnto a alley and tltho not bad, its not fun to look out to a brick wall when you are in the CITY!!!! all the rooms on the front tho are one bed so our boys slept on the CLEAN NIC KEPT FLOOR!!! the hotel even offered us free extra blankets and pillows for us!!!! along with the room is a clean bath bigger then i planned on being in the city and all and the room was basic but great great location only 1/2 block from times square!!! check in is not overly friendly but you dont pay for that since the prices are pretty low for you where you are staying!!!!

Oct 17 2006 	Highly recommend this hotel!	Myself, my mother and my sister stayed in this hotel for 5 nights while on a shopping trip. It is in an excellent location and terrific value for money. Everything is within walking distance, broadway, 5th Av, Macys, Port Authority etc... Breakfast was included in the price which included bagels, cereal, pastries etc.. and the guy looking after the breakfast was great and don't forget to tip him! There was free computer and internet access...very handy. The room and ensuite were clean and tidy, and cleaned every day!!! Great choice for a trip to NY, have stayed in other hotels on other trips and none of them come close....will definitely be back!

Oct 5 2006 	Great Value	New York City: Comfort Inn MidtownDate: Sept. 26 - 30, 2006Reviewer: Trip Advisor Member, Burlington,CanadaThis hotel provides very good value for the money. The room was $162 per night. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was plenty large enough for 2 people. We did not spend a lot of time in the room. Most of our waking hours were spent sight seeing. The room was very clean. The only drawback was that the room faced 46th street and thus was quite noisey. My wife and I are fairly sound sleepers so this did not really bother us that much. Other rooms may be much quieter. The breakfast provided was typical of many hotels. We ate shotly after the breakfast room opened (7:00 am) and found everything satisfactory. The breakfast was as advertised. There was only on small elevator. We did not experience any long waits. We were on the 3rd floor and often walked down the stairs. The location is great. There are many restaurants nearby. Times Square is less than a block away. You can walk to many attractions such as Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, many theaters, Times Square and the bus tours (hop on/ hop off).This is a great place to stay. We would stay here again.

Oct 2 2006	Great Location for a room with no view :)	We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for 5 nights 9/26-10/1. We stayed here because we were on a budget and it was $179/night and the best we could find in the location. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel for the price. The hotel staff were very friendly. The continental breakfast was nice as well as the business center where we were able to check our emails and print our boarding passes for NO CHARGE! The room was pretty small but we were only there long enough to sleep so that didnt bother me. I also requsted a room away from the street so we didnt have any problems with noise. I did hear the slamming doors once in awhile but not enough to disrupt my sleep. Luckily we were on the 2nd floor, so we used the stairs the whole time. I did notice the elevator was very slow so I am glad we were on the 2nd floor. Overall, it was a fine hotel for the price and I would definitely stay here again. The location is excellent and you are close to subway stops.

Sep 26 2006	Value for money	We were staying in Comfort Inn Midtown, New York 4 nights before we went on a cruise. The hotel considering the price was above average, situated in the heart of Manhatten, the service in top, very friendly and I could go on praising the hotel. The only negative experience was the noise from the street, why I advice the owners to install windows with double glaser .

Sep 17 2006 	I agree this is a very good option	Hi! When I was planning my first-ever trip to New York City I really did not know where to stay and I admit the reviews that I read in Trip Advisor where the key element in order to choose the Comfort Inn Midtown. After a four-night stay my conclusion is that I agree to previous reviews in the sense that this hotel is a very good option in New York City.I do not have new things to add to the many reviews posted here, but I would like to comment my agreement on the following advantages of the Comfort Inn Midtown:Price.- Very affordable considering the hotel is closely located to Times Square.Room/bathroom cleanliness.- They were spotless in my experience.Room amenities.- No luxuries here but you find adequate space for clothes (corner closet), iron, ironing board, hairdryer, coffee maker, radio alarm & TV. Hotel amenities.- I found the free Internet access (two computers in a business room), complimentary breakfast, and free daily newspaper as a plus. There is also a fitness room but I did not use it; it seemed small but adequate.Location.- As it has been repeatedly noted, the hotel is close to Times Square and the Rockefeller subway station; the convenient location gives you the chance to walk and be part of many activities or to take the subway or a bus wherever you want to go.Staff.- In my experience, the maid and the breakfast room attendant were even friendlier than the front desk staff, but in general terms all of the employees are kind and attentive.On the other hand, some travelers have noticed weaknesses and noted them here; I have an opinion on the following:Slamming doors.- Yes, doors do slam, then it is a good idea to be careful when closing them.Elevator.- It is old and small indeed but no big deal; my room was in the sixth floor so I usually took the elevator and its service was functional enough.Room size.- I do not know other New York hotels room size, thus I lack a point of comparison; the room seemed small (I got a queen-size bed) but I do not need more space. Perhaps the rooms are too small if you travel with your family, but I did not have the chance to see a two-bed room to have an opinion on that.Temperature.- Other reviews complained of rooms being too hot no problem in my stay, since tropical storm Ernesto brought rainy days to the city.As a side note, throughout the almost 250 TripAdvisor Traveler Reviews about the Comfort Inn Midtown, there are some descriptions that are actually referring to the Comfort Inn Manhattan, which is located in 35th St and has a total of 12 floors; the Comfort Inn Midtown is a smaller hotel, with a total of 9 floors (new readers of these reviews, please take this into account any descriptions of a 12-floor hotel and two elevators are actually not referring to the Comfort Inn Midtown).Overall, I would stay in this hotel again.

Sep 9 2006	Good location Gruff but later helpful staff Great value	I booked a night here based on the reviews here. This one really rose to the top as the best hotel under $200/night.I wanted a clean room for a night after a red-eye and didn't want to pay the $300/night that most name brand hotels were charging.Upon arrival, they weren't able to give us a room. Understandable since it was 8am. We returned after breakfast at a local diner and were again told that we couldn't get a room until 12 or 1. This is better than the standard 3-4 pm check in times, but we figured that they'd have an early check out and be able to get us in sometime sooner.We ended up killing a little time in the lobby and our patience paid off. Probably 15 minutes after 9, they were able to get us a clean room that more than met our expectations. Sure the room was small, but not unreasonably small. I'd say comparable to rooms in San Francisco or Europe. I'd stay there again and definitely feel it's worth the $100 in savings.

Sep 7 2006	Great Hotel for a NYC Trip!!	My wife and I stayed at the hotel on September 3, 2006. Yes, the rooms are small, but when you are in NYC how much time do you actually stay in the room? The bathroom was small as well, but again, how much room do you really need in the bathroom. Both the room, bathroom, and lobby were CLEAN. The air conditioner was a window unit that provided adequate cooling power (we like our room cool). Room ammenities included: iron and ironing board, hairdryer, and coffee pot.The location is great because it is between time square and 6th avenue.The only suggestion I would make for a person who is staying at this hotel, is to call the hotel and ask if there are any festivals going on that would block the street. We happened to be arriving during Brazil day, and could not access the street by car which required us to park 7 blocks away instead of the parking garage across the street from the hotel.OVERALL: We would def. stay in this hotel again!

Aug 23 2006	Great hotel and great location	My boyfriend and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown in the middle of July. The room was small but that was fine with us because who wants to spend a lot of time in the hotel anyway... The room was also very clean and the staff was always extremely nice and helpful. Aug 15 2006 	Clean with a great location	This hotel was better than expected. It was close to Times Square (1/2 a block away) and close to grand central station (3 blocks). The most important thing was that the rooms were clean. The bathroom was clean too! I know that other reviews said something about church bells, but we were right next to the church and didn't hear the bells. The only noisy thing was our child neighbor screaming at 11pm and then slamming the door to her room about 10 times. This is of course nothing that the hotel could have controlled. It was very convient to have free internet access (two computers) in the lobby. The free breakfast was also very nice. My fiance even used their fitness room which was very small but had a bike, treadmill, and stairmaster. The best part of this hotel was the unbeatable price of $110 per night! I would stay here again and reccommend it to my friends!Oh and we also stopped in Havanna central (right on 46th street a couple doors away from the hotel) for dinner and it was fantasitic especially the mojitos!

Aug 14 2006 	building work!	Nice hotel, at this price. First room offered was a single (that claimed to be a double). I could not see two 200lb people getiing into the bed. Jul 12 2006	Better than expected	We stayed here from June 10-17, 2006. We had booked a room with a King bed and sofabed in November 2005. Jun 28 2006	I agree heartily - this is a great Location!!!	I have just spent 7 nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown, New York City. The Inn is situated a mere couple of minutes walk from Times Square and there are lots of local eateries (at various food prices and choices.) As well, it is close to the Hop On - Hop Off buses at Times Square and within walking distance to many of New York's vast sights and subway stations. The room my husband and I were allocated was very small, as was the bathroom (shower stall/toilet/washbasin). The room was clean - but do NOT expect 5 star accommodation. Jun 26 2006	good spot for a night or two	I stayed at this midtown location, on west 36th streeet, on june 9th. The location was pretty good, about a 5-10 minute walk to the subway. Jun 19 2006	Rooms are tiny hotel is clean staff are friendly	I turned to Trip Advisor for a weekend stay in November 2005 at the Comfort Inn. For what it's worth, here's my experience. The lobby is nicely lit, lots of shiny brass, and it's clean. The elevator up to the sixth floor was tight, the smallest I've ever ridden. It was a taste of things to come. The bed's headboard was two feet to the right of the doorway. A desk lay six feet straight ahead, then the wall. Walking in anywhere in the room meant circling the bed. But the place was clean, including the small bathroom with shower (no tub). There was ample closet space. I'd guess the room was 10' by 10' (3m x 3m).For November, which was bitterly cold, the room was quite warm. Too warm in fact; we left our window open during the day, as there's no thermostat (the whole hotel is heated to same temp. all winter, per agreement with utility company, front desk said.) Not a biig problem. The room was set back from the street and quiet enough. My sister-in-law, her husband and their 1-year-old shared a room next to us. It was about 1/3 bigger for the same price. The hotel's biggest asset is its location. You can't get much closer to Times Square. If you're a budget tourist, this is the place to stay. The continental breakfast was fine -- cereal, milk, coffee and donuts. (My Aussie in-laws thought this was a hoot, as no one in Australia eats donuts for *breakfast.* They'd only heard of such a thing on "The Simpsons.") An attendant lingered in the breakfast room, making sure we had ample milk, coffee etc. He works on tips -- a buck is appreciated.Overall, I'd stay here again if I was on a budget. It's not luxurious. But it's modern and it's clean and it's in Times Square. If you don't plan on spending much time in your room, you'll be fine.

Jun 14 2006	Clean Comfortable Friendly Staff	Read all reviews before staying at this hotel. Was still reluctant because the room rate was so reasonable. We stayed for three nights. Would I return? Jun 14 2006	Location location location	We loved this place! It's small and nothing fancy but what do you expect for the price? Jun 13 2006	Avoid if you are a light sleeper...	Just came back from a long week-end in NYC. I agree with everybody. We could hear the TV and the children speak in the room next to ours and everything that was going on in the hallway (a family was sharing multiple rooms and was constantly going from one room to the others, screaming, laughing and slamming doors; it was awful). In addition, its New York City; people were coming in and out at all hours, slamming doors and screaming in the small hallway. I had problems falling asleep because of all the noise and was constantly waken up afterwards. In the middle of the night, after 3 or 4, I was finally able to sleep. Jun 6 2006	Would definitely stay there again	Just returned from staying at the Comfort Inn Midtown for 5 nights. Total price per night including taxes was $200. We usually stay at 3 or 4 star hotels but tried out a 2-star for a change (and price was much better). The hotel was small (in size and number of rooms) which was nice for a change. The elevator was big enough for about 8 people (or 3 with luggage). Warning - watch out for the elevator door! It slams FAST and HARD and I still have the bruise on my hand to prove it. The halls were very narrow. Our room was the smallest I have ever stayed in but was adequate. I called it a "one-way room" because only one person could walk around at a time! The window air conditioner was great and not loud at all - just a quiet hum. We were on the back facing the church next door and heard the church bells a lot which was nice. Actually, that was the only noise we heard the whole trip from our room. The bathroom was larger than I had expected. It even had a large frosted window in it and a large ledge to sit your stuff on. We only had the breakfast 2 mornings and it was fine - bagels, toast, boiled eggs, cereal, donuts, fruit, coffee, orange and apple juice, cappucino, coffee and tea. One person said there were only 4 tables in there, but there were 8 (I think). We did have to wait a couple of minutes one day. I think it would have been nice if the people who were finished would have left and given up their table instead of sitting there planning the day's itinerary while we stood there. The computer room (2 computers, free internet) was a nice plus because we could check on a few things while we were there. All the employees were friendly. One other thing - the doors really do SLAM when you leave your room. They usually started around 7 a.m. All you have to do is keep your hand on the handle and pull it shut and it won't slam. We couldn't figure out why people let them slam so much. Rude, I guess. Anyway, bottom line is this hotel was great for the money and location, I would highly recommend it if you wanted a nice place to sleep and shower, and we would definitely stay there again.

Jun 6 2006	excellent location excellent value	this is a small friendly hotel in a great location and offering excellent value for money, with breakfast included!. Jun 1 2006	A very nice hotel in the midst of Times Square	What a gem! We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. May 31 2006	Great Location	As all the other reviewers say this hotel is in a great location, so close to Times Square and of course the subway in Times Square. May 29 2006	Enjoyed The Comfort In Mid Town NYC	My wife and I stayed at the Mid Town Comfort Inn for three nights and enjoyed it tremendously. May 27 2006	Location but a bot noisy	Nice hotel and a great location, the only down side was the noise in the morning. Our room overlooked the main street and was on the fifth floor. May 13 2006	Small but great location	Booked this hotel via the web for a 1 night stopover on my way back from CT. The location is awesome! A Continental breakfast is offered and was very convenient. The hotel was very clean, even the basement where the ice machine is located. The bathroom was nice and it seems to be recently redone so it is not one of those 30 year old NY bathrooms. The good part is you can do everything by standing in one place :) I could touch all the walls from standing in the middle of the bathroom. Cruise ships have bigger cabins and showers, no kidding.  As others have mentioned, the room was very hot even while it was cool outside. The have signs saying do not open the window so I turned on the window AC and it never got the room cold. The view was of a brick wall 2 feet away :) My friends were staying at the Pennsylvania on 34th street and I went down to meet them. Compared to the Comfort Inn the hotel was very dirty. The hallways were drab and in need of repair as was the room. I would never stay there. I take that back, I might stay there, but not with my wife. I added this in just for comparison. Oh yea, the line to check in was about 30 minutes. The longest line I saw at the Comfort Inn was 1 person. Would I stay there again, you bet! If I was going by myself or with my wife for just 1 or 2 nights it would be perfect. The location, the cleanliness and the friendly staff make it a nice place to stay.

May 7 2006	Good Choice Excellent Value	We chose this hotel after much searching and reading the reviews of many many hotels in Manhattan.We are extremely fussy about cleanliness and can honestly say that the room was clean with a comfortable bed which was also very clean. May 7 2006	locationlocationlocation	This hotel is one-half a block from time square.The staff are great,rooms were clean,the beakfast was good. Rooms on the small side but well maintained. Would return next trip. Canada loves New York City

Apr 18 2006	Enjoyed the area	A great place to stay especially for the fair price, the convinence and close to Time Square, one block away. Continental breakfast a good plus. Apr 18 2006	Cozy and Comfortable Hotel	We spent four days in New York in March prior to a cruiseand I was SO glad I had chosen the Comfort Inn Midtown.It was extremely cold and windy while we were there and we were glad we could go to wonderful restaurants close by and a short walk to the Broadway shows. Apr 2 2006	Great Location.Very good value	Stayed here for one night and was very impressed with the hotel.The location is great.Very close to Times Square,Radio City,and Rockefeller Plaza.Parking across the street was $20 for 24 hrs.Easy check-in.The rooms were basic but clean.Couldn't beat the price of $150 for midtown Manhattan.Will be staying here again on my next trip to NYC.

Mar 31 2006	Bit of a Letdown...But	After reading the great reviews on this website, me and my boyfriend booked this hotel for a 4 night stay in New York.
