The gentleman that checked us in told us that he was going to put us on the quiet side of the hotel. Quiet meant facing a brick wall, which really didn't bother my husband and I. The main problem was the temperature of the room. It was uncomfortably warm and there was no way to turn the heat down. We voiced our concerns at the desk and the said that they would look intoit. Obviously there was ot much that anyone could do, since the heating system seems to be automatic. Even though there was a sign that said not to open the window, we did anyway. Unfortunately this did not help the temperature of the room. I'm not sure what the answer to the problem was. The morning breakfast was quite adequate and the location could not be beat. Maybe if it is cold outside itwould not be a problem. I should have tried plugging in the air conditioning unit to see if that would have cooled off the room.

Mar 16 2006	Best hotel I've ever stayed at!!!	Ok.. now i've stayed in hotels all over the world (from $$$ to $) and I must say for the price you pay, this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Stayed there my 1st & 2nd times in NYC (both being a single female traveler). Hotel is a 1/2 block from Times Square & Theatre District and 2 blocks from Rockerfella Center, NBC Studios, 5th Avenue Shopping. ALL hotel staff was more than helpful and extremely friendly. Hotel was very clean, and was not a bad size for a NY hotel room. Featured on a quiet side street with no traffic noise at night. Very secure & safe would recommend it to any one! Hotel windows didn't have the best view, because you are on a side street, but who wants to stay in the hotel all day? Especially when you're so close to the action!

Mar 7 2006	Great "Value for Money" Hotel!!!	Just returned from a trip to New York. Spent a week at the Comfort Inn, Midtown. I chose this hotel after much research on the Trip Advisor web site and can honestly say that I thought this hotel was excellent. The location of the hotel was great, just 2 mins walk and you are in Times Square. I went with my two daughters and we stayed in a room for 4 which had 2 queen sized beds in. The room was not big but was adequate. It was very clean and sheets and towels were changed every day. Our room was at the back of the hotel so we didn't have a "view" but this was not important as we didn't spend much time in the hotel room! The staff in the hotel were always very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included in the price and this included toast, cereal, bagels, doughnuts, fresh fruit, tea, coffee and fruit juice. If I ever return to New York I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced hotel in an excellent location.

Mar 4 2006	What a deal	This hotel is perfectly situated and is the bargain of the century. For about $100 you stay on 46th St close to Times Square, free contintental breakfast and a clean room with pleasant staff. What more could you ask for? If you're looking for luxury this is not the place. If you want comfortable accomodations at a reasonable price it is the place for you.

Mar 4 2006	Still A Bargain	This was my second time staying two nights at this hotel in the past eight months. I got a great midweek rate with my Auto Club discount, $98.99. I arrived about 2 1/2 hours prior to check-in but was given a room anyway. Check-in was lengthy because I arrived on March 1st, the day a new computer system was introduced, so there were some glitches with it, but that was to be expected and I didn't mind, since I was early anyway. The room I had this time, while still a queen-size, was a bit larger than the last time I stayed there, as was the bathroom. However, it seemed a bit more worn down than before: the bedspread had seen better days, the carpet was shredded where it met the bathroom, the telephone cord was frayed, the phone books were outdated, and there was a strange dent in the wall. I was on the sixth floor on the church side (the hotel is adjacent to a Catholic Church) so I did hear the church bells regularly. The room was very hot. When I asked the cleaning lady how to adjust the heat she simply opened the window, in the middle of a snowstorm! And there's still the problem with the doors that close themselves and slam loudly while doing so. If you're a business traveler and needing to get up in the morning this might not bother you, but I was there on pleasure and didn't enjoy the slams at 6:30 in the morning. Overall, however, this is still a good deal and the location can't be beat. You're right between subway stops at Times Square and Rockefeller Center, and my favorite Cuban restaurant, Havana Central, is just down the street. (Check out their dulce de leche martinis.) In fact, just about anything you could possibly need is within walking distance, the staff is pleasant and helpful, and the free continental breakfast will save you a few bucks.

Feb 28 2006	Great Deal!	Trying to find a hotel in NY was harder than I expected, I didn't realize that just staying for one night was expensive almost everywhere I looked until I found the Comfort Inn Midtown. If you use your triple A card you recieve a discount of $99 a night (we stayed on a Sunday night). Yes the room was small, but for two people it was all we needed. Very clean, staff was very nice and there was free continental breakfast which was good. There is a deli only a few buildings down for a great lunch or snack. I would definetely reccomend this hotel.

Feb 24 2006	Wonderful!	This hotel exceeded my expectations. I arrived 3 hours before check-in but was given a room right away. Everybody at this hotel was helpful and pleasant. The room was small, but it was spotless, quiet, and featured all the amenities. And, as everbody says, the location can't be beat. I will definitely stay here again. It is a budget hotel in price only - a real New York City jewel.

Feb 22 2006	Location Location Location!	Similar to the last post, problems may occur if you check-in late at night.We were 2 couples, & we booked this hotel after spending hours looking at other reviews & prices etc. We booked the room over the telephone directly with Applecore Hotels in September 2005 & I received a fax confirming our booking. It did state on the fax that if we were going to check-in after 10 pm to let the hotel know in advance. As our flight wasn't due to land until around 11 pm, I sent the hotel an e-mail a month ago to let them know. I never received an acknowledgement even though I requested one. The week before we went, I sent another e-mail, this time directly to Applecore Hotels, also requesting that they acknowledge this, but again, no response.When we finally arrived at the hotel, it was 1am & as soon as we stepped into the lobby, the clerk looked up, knew our names but then proceeded to say that a slight problem had occurred & that due to a 'medical emergency', the last guests who were in our room had to stay on for another night & that he had made arrangements for us to stay at a hotel down the road for the same price for 1 night only. The other hotel was Super 8, again owned by Applecore. We didn't have a lot of choice at that time in the morning, especially as we knew that they already had our credit card details. We were bundled into a taxi & given $5 to pay the fare, and we literally drove about 200 yards up the road to the other hotel.We didn't want to bother unpacking for 1 night & thought about staying there for the rest of our trip, a further 3 nights, but it was around $50 more expensive per night. It was a good job we didn't! Our room was overlooking the street, & the noise was unbearable all night long. The curtains didn't close & the blinds were all tattered & ripped, the lighting in both the bedroom & the bathroom was dismal.The next morning we checked out, & walked back to the Comfort Inn. I was pleasantly surprised at our rooms. They were so peaceful! No noise at all (no view either) but at least we could sleep OK. The bed was kingsize & very comfortable. There was loads of space for clothes, iron, hairdryer, coffee making & a large TV.The bedroom/bathroom was so much better than the other hotel, also very clean.There was also FREE internet access in the lobbyThe breakfast was the usual, cereal, toast, bagels & choice of pastries & fruit. They even had Tetley T-Bags! Couldn't complain about the facilities there.The main thing about this hotel is the location. You simply walk out of the lobby, turn right & within 1 minute, you are standing outside TGI Fridays, right in Times Square. By the way, look out for the web cam directly outside of TGI's-It's great fun having a morning wave into the camera & lots of people obviously had family/friends at home on the internet looking at www.earthcam.com where it's real time.On the way back to the hotel every night, we stopped at a Cuban bar a few doors up from the hotel for a nightcap. Brilliant atmosphere, great music & lovely Cubre Libres!All in all, yes, it was great shame about the beginning of this trip, but once settled in, we were all happy to have chosen this hotel & it would be my first choice when we return to New York.(We paid $109 Fri night $139 Sat & Sun, this rate was per room & included breakfast, but not taxes)Please feel free to ask any questions.

Feb 15 2006	Don't Check in at night	Hotel is a great deal- especially when you book far in advance. Unfortunately, don't expect your room to be there if you are coming in late at night. We arrived at 11:30pm and were told that they had given our 2 rooms away because they couldn't charge our card. 2 hours later and on the phone with credit card company who was telling us that we had been charged for the rooms that night, we had the night desk person offer us 2 rooms at 3 times the rate we booked. We had to walk around times square and find a small hotel for the night and had to come back the next day to deal with the manager. Not a good way to start your trip! Once the manager cleared everything up and apologized (we were still out an extra $300), things seemed to be looking up. On our 2nd night there, my friend caught one of the desk people going into our room to look for "tape"- we had not been told or called and so he went in and watched them while they moved a couple of things around and left.As much as it was a great deal initially, sometimes it's true that you get what you pay for.

Feb 12 2006	Great location	Was a little nervous about this hotel, but had read the reviews and reckoned it was worth a chance. The location is great - Times Square at the end of the road. The staff were friendly and helpful and the free breakfast was a bonus. The room was a little cramped - but who cares? It was nice and warm and very clean. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel, and even the pillows were great. I am recommending this to everyone I know - it is a real bargain.

Feb 12 2006	Compact Gem!	Great hotel in the middle of midtown. Great value and ok sized rooms. Continental breakfast in the best ive had in a budget inn! Look for Antonio doing breakfast, he will look after you. All in all a great place to stay in NYC. Would stay there again.

Feb 6 2006	Great Buy as Well as Friendly Staff	This small hotel just off Time Square is just what it is advertised plus you get a staff that genuinely makes you feel you are welcome. From instructions how to ride the subway to getting half price tickets for some shows, Ivonne and CDB were a wealth of information and also eager for out-of-towners, new to the city to enjoy themselves. Rooms are small but newly remodeled, clean, and very realistically priced. We will stay there again.S. Schenck - New Orleans

Feb 3 2006	A midtown value miracle	This is a remarkable value in the heart of the theatre district. You`re literally a one minute walk to Times Square and not much further to Rockerfeller Center and Fifth Avenue shopping. Everything in this 79 room hotel is compact, including the welcoming mahogany and marble lobby. The staff greets you warmly and they are eager to respond to your questions and requests. There is a single elevator that will take you to your compact, but well thought out room. Everything seems new here. You`ll find very nice neo-shaker furnishings, floral patterned, valanced draperies and matching bedspreads. Our mattress was firm and extremely comfortable. The carpeting and colorfully bordered wallpaper are unblemished. There is also subtle recessed ceiling lighting and a small but adequate corner closet. We were on the top floor in room 904 with a queen sized bed. We were on the side of the building and didn`t hear a sound from the street or from neighboring guests. Rooms ending in 01 and 02 are directly on the 46th street side and will probably have street noise. The compact, sparkling bathroom is all new with floor to ceiling white tiles, marble floor, pedestal sink and gleaming fixtures....also Comfort Inns` signature curved shower bar. You`ll also find all of Comfort Inns` regular amenities here, including free local calls, iron/ironing board, newspaper, and available toiletries from housekeeping, just in case you`ve forgotten something. There is also a very good free expanded continental breakfast in the compact, but pleasant breakfast room off the lobby. This includes, pastries, bagels, breads, juices, yogurts, fruit, cereal, coffee and even cappucino. For all this we paid an unbelievable $89 per night. Housekeeping keeps everything spotless here and maintenance is also impressive. I challenge anyone to find a better rate for this kind of quality in New York. We met friends who were staying at a neighboring hotel and paying nearly 3 times as much for a shabby, dirty room, a rude staff, and no breakfast. We`ll definitely be making this our hotel home whenever we visit the city. Not to be missed!!

Feb 1 2006	Another Successful Stay / Great Value	After reading several favourable reviews of this property, we stayed there for the 2nd time in the last 8 months. Once again, the rooms were clean and of ample size (especially for NYC). The location near Times Square is ideal to walk to many locations or to access the nearby subway lines. Staff are great to deal with and very helpful.We will definitely be returning to this hotel in the future.

Jan 20 2006	Great hotel even better value	We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for two nights, and our stay couldn't have been better!For us the LOCATION of this hotel, along with the fair price, sold us.The staff was also very helpful and pleasant. We arrived 3 hours before check-in, and they did allow us to check in early.We were on the 9th floor... room 903. It was small, but not as small as I thought it would be! The room was spotless, and the bathroom was fine. While there is no counter, there is a large windowsill that you can put your toiletries on. Our view looked out to another building, but we could also see some NY sights!This hotel is IN the theatre district, and is in walking distance to MANY attractions. You can get to the airport via a $28 cab ride, or take the train and bus, which only costs $4 per person.Overall, I don't think we'd stay anywhere else in NYC!

Jan 19 2006	Lovely Location and Friendly Staff	This hotel exceeded my expectations. The location was perfect and the staff from the front desk to the bellhop was friendly and nice. I felt welcome and the staff often went out of their way to accomodate. I was offered coffee so many times when walking thru the lobby. Great experience. An excellent place to spend my MLK weekend.

Jan 18 2006	Last-minute reservation first-rate stay!	When my son and I had an opportunity to stay an extra night in NY but hadn't made a hotel reservation, I read in the NY Times Guide to NY that the Comfort Inn Midtown was a reasonable choice for budget travelers like us. I called at the last minute and got a double room for $100, and I couldn't believe the value! The room was small, but clean and modern. No view to speak of, but very quiet on the back side of the hotel. Everything worked, beds were comfortable, and a fairly good continental breakfast was available beginning at 7 a.m. The location was extremely convenient, near theaters, subway, Midtown attractions. I am recommending this place to everyone I know and plan to stay there the next time we are visiting New York.

Jan 17 2006	perfect location great value	We have just returned from 7 nights at this hotel. It has been wonderful. The location couldn't be better. A few minutes walk from nearest metro station and Times Square. 10 to 15 minutes walk from bus station where we were dropped by shuttle bus from Newark Airport. Very pleasant check in with no question about not being able to have our room before check in time.2nd floor back room plenty big enough for city hotel. Deliciously comfy bed. Everything working in the bathroom and all spotlessly clean. View of concrete wall and quite dark but this was compensated by being completely quiet. No sound of traffic at any time. We thought this was a great bonus considering it is right in the centre. Why do people slam doors though? There's no need. With care they could be closed with a little click. This was the only noise we heard. Don't know how anybody can complain about the free breakfast. Juice, cereal, coffee, chocolate, bagels, bread, jam, philly etc, all looked after by a fastidious guy who kept it all spotlessly clean.Don't like to criticise this hotel at all but there was just one thing. Our room was never made up until about 3pm. This meant that it was a bit of a problem if we fancied going back to have a little rest in the afternoon - we usually went out about 7.15am. Only a small thing but that would have made it a perfect budget city hotel. As it is it is pretty damned near!!!! Would return again any time.

Jan 15 2006	Location location!!!!	The best thing about this hotel is the location - walk down the street and you are in the middle of Times Square - you can't fault that! The room was an ok size - a long time since it has been renovated though - we had to change rooms from a room at the front of the building - garbage trucks all night! But our room towards the back of the hotel was much better - the hotel has a very ancient lift - still works but feels very rickety - free breakfast included - basically donuts, toast, coffee and tea and juice - not much else - If you could pay the same rate and be in as good a location then I would look for somewhere else a bit more modern - but if it is all you can afford, and want to be in the middle of the manhattan action and do not have high expectations then this is the place for you - nothing wrong with it - just is very basic.

Jan 4 2006	No comfort at the Comfort Inn	My girldfriend and I (both in our early 20's) stayed at the Comfort Inn for 2 nights (January 1st and 2nd).We arrived at 1h30 PM on January the 1st and were told that no room were ready since everyone went to bed late the night before bla bla bla (room maid began their shift at 9h30 AM so...) by the rude receptionnist who told us that check-in was at 3h PM and not before. Coming from the Barclay Intercontinental where we had a room at 8H30AM, we felt kinda mad, but still, waited.We got our room at 2h45 PM. The room was on the 5th floor which was obviously on the small side. The AC unit wasn't working and the heating system was way to hot, so we had to sleep with the window open all night (but it wasn't that bad, not that noisy outside...well, that's before 7h AM when the nearby church rings it's bells.)The bathroom was discusting, hair (and pubic hair) rolling all over the floor. The location and the price however cannot be beat! The good thing about having a crappy room is that you definitly don't want to stay inside. Therefore, you spend more time in NY than in your room!

Dec 28 2005	Great Location--no extra beds!!	This hotel has a terrific location--midway between Rockefeller Center and Broadway. Room was generous in size with a queen bed but no opportunity for a rollaway for an additional person, despite being assured that this was possible through Hotels.com. Price was very reasonable for date (Christmas week) and location. Climate control was not so great--room seemed warm and hard to turn the heat down and 1 towel looked to have hair on it (though appeared not to have been used). Positives include location, location, location, free use of computer with printer in lobby, small exercise facility and free generous breakfast including good bagels, donuts, cold cereal, coffee, juice, fresh apples and bananas and firm mattress. All in all a good value for the price and a discount of 10% if over age 50.

Dec 19 2005	Very nice hotel in excellent location	Just returned from a pleasant weekend trip to New York where we stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Cant say enough good things about a clean and attractive, reasonably priced hotel, conveniently located in the Times Square-Theater District. Our 6th floor room was recently renovated along with new furnishings.Although on the smaller side, the room was more than comfortable and accommodated a Queen size bed. The location couldnt be better with major attractions, such as Times Square, Empire State Building, St. Patricks Cathedral, Macys , Rockefeller Center, Radio City and Central Park, within easy walking distance. The hotel staff were all extremely pleasant and in the mornings, guests were provided a complimentary breakfast of pastries, bagels, fruit, coffee and juices. Definitely planning to stay here again on return visits to New York City!

Dec 14 2005	Very Friendly Great Value but "OK" hotel	My husband, sons (ages 3 and 6) and I had stayed at The Hampton Inn for one night the first week of December. We wanted to extend our trip, but The Hampton was booked, so we chose the Comfort Inn Midtown for our second night. We chose this hotel because the price could not be beat, and the reviews on this website were favorable. We paid under $300 (total with tax)for one night ,while all the other rooms we had looked up online were $400 plus. The hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly, but the rooms are very small. The window in our room had a wall air conditioner in it, and the blinds above the AC were closed. When I peeked out the window, all I pretty much saw was another building or wall, very close. The room was a little dark because of this lack of outside light. The heating system is old; we had a radiator in our room, which had to be manually turned on.I was concerned that the room would get too hot, but it didn't.( There was cold air coming in the room from the window air condioner.) The radiator was enclosed behind a door (with a panel on it that allowed for the heat to escape.)Behind this door, in front of the radiator, was the largest rat trap I have ever seen.(I think it was maybe the only rat trap I have ever seen!) I suppose this is common in New York, but I would have preferred not to have seen it. Also, two of the pillows in our room were torn; you could see the stuffing inside of them. Maybe our expectations were a little high because we had just come from a hotel that had been recently upgraded, and had larger rooms. We're thankful that the price was right, and that everyone was friendly.(The bellhop was especially helpful, and kind to my kids.)However, we don't think this hotel will be our first choice when we return to New York.

Dec 9 2005	Will stay there again	We stayed here for 5 nights, from November 30 through December 5. I booked it because of all the good reviews on Tripadvisor, AND because it was probably the least expensive hotel in the area. What a gem it turned out to be. It is one half block from Times Square, yet our room was very quiet. Though small, the room was very clean and comfortable. We were on the 7th floor with a view of the roof of the church next door. (By the way, one of the other recent reviews here said that you can have a view of the Empire State Building: not true, they must have confused this Comfort Inn with a different one). One peculiarity was that it seemed that the radiator-type heat was always on, which is good because it was very cold in NYC, but the only way to reduce the heat to a comfortable level was to turn on the air conditioner. It worked, so no problem. The people at the front desk were extremely helpful and attentive. They found deals for us to various attractions, and booked a sedan for us back to the airport, as well as let us store our luggage until we left in the afternoon. When we return to New York City we will most definitely stay there again.

Dec 6 2005	Great Experience	After searching for a "reasonably-priced" place to stay in Midtown Manhattan, this is what we settled on. (There really is no such thing as a clean, nice place to stay that is truly reasonable in NYC.) At any rate, we were very pleasantly surprised. If you close the curtains (thereby eliminating the view of the brick wall) you might imagine yourself in a quaint country inn. The room was a bit small, but it was cozy, clean and really quite lovely. We didn't spend much time in the room, but that was not the point of this vacation.We would stay there again in a New York minute. :-)

Nov 29 2005	A gem in the city	We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for five nights in November. It may not be the ritz but it is a very comfortable, clean hotel in a fantastic location (times square is one block away). The staff are very friendly and helpful - I wanted to change rooms after the first night as it was unseasonably warm in New York and the room was unbearably hot - we were given a new room no problem. All this with a free breakfast! I searched for weeks to find the perfect hotel but having read the reviews on tripadvisor I opted for a reasonably priced comfortable hotel and found a gem!

Nov 19 2005	Great hotel!!	My husband and i stayed at the comfort inn midtown from 2 sep-9sep.We got a great rate at 149 dollars pr night and the location was just the best,espesially for us travelling to New York for the first time.The housekeeper kept it clean and we got fresh towels every day.And what a quiet hotel...i cant belive that i stayed a half block from times square.Minus for small room and our window facing a brick wall.Remember to tip the man in the breakfast room,he was so helpful and nice. He is also the man who`s vacuing the hallways,so he is working for his bucks :o).It`s in a such a great location that we didn`t take a taxi once...used the subway for long distances but walked almost everywhere.We had a great time and would defenetly stay there again.

Nov 18 2005	Fantastic Hotel	Stayed here last December, and it was a fantastic hotel to saty in. We were there for 4 nights. The room was non-smoking as requested, and imagine our joy when we got to the room (near the top of the hotel), flung back the curtains to see a fantatstic view of the empire state building, as it is just the block behind. When you book, try and book a room at the 'back left corner' of the hotel, to get the view. Waking up to the empire state building in the dawn and seeing it lit up at night was brilliant. Clean hotel, decor a little shabby in the room but hey. Clean towels daily. The concierge was lovely, very helpful, couldn't do enough for us. Great location as well, right by macys and fifth ave, subway on the corner of the block. We flew into Newark airport and took the airtrain to Penn station, this hotel is a couple of blocks walk away - no need for a cab.We're off to NYC in a couple of weeks, unfortunlaty left it too late to book in here again :( trying the new yorker instead this time, will see how it measures up!

Nov 14 2005 	Comfort Inn Midtown: Not Bad at All	Hey, for under $200 bucks (since my husband is considered a "mature traveler" at age 51--we got a 10% discount)--this place isn't half bad.Here's what was good: The price, the adequate free breakast, and close to theaters & shopping--we walked everywhere!! For under $200--the rooms were mildly spacious. We were four blocks from Jersey Boys (great show!! I highly recommend it), and the hotel arranged for a shuttle to take us back to the airport (23 bucks each)...The not so good: Two not so plush towels (asked for more, but never got them); no view; rather noisy all over, and not so good toiletries or lighting in the bathroom.I'd stay there again--not fancy, but bearable!

Nov 2 2005 	excellent for the price	Great location and clean with wireless internet, coffeemaker, tv, iron and a one computer-printer business center. Linens seemed fresh and of decent quality. The room was tiny and had no view but was still a bargain. As to a former comment about loud door noise, my door wouldn't lock unless you slammed it. I mean that's what the staff told me to do to get my door to lock -- and didn't understand when I tried to explain that it would disturb the neighbors. They could work on that issue for sure....

Oct 24 2005	Clean room Pleasant Staff Good Location for Theaters But..	My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown earlier this month. We arrived in NYC very early in the AM and they stored our luggage until our room was ready - shortly after 10:30 AM - hours before official check-in time! Throughout our 3 night stay we found staff to be very helpful and pleasant.This Comfort Inn is in a great location for attending the theater and not bad for exploring the city. And the price is certainly resonable for Manhattan. The room was clean, the bathroom was small but attractive, the shower had good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The room was very small, however, and the mattress on our bed had seen better days - saggy in the middle. The bedspread was clean but very tired. The biggest problem was the noise from the hallway. Any time someone closed a door on the hall it reverberated in our room loudly enough to startle you out of a deep sleep. We turned on the AC fan to try and drown out the noise but it was not enough. The view from our window was of a brick wall about a foot away. This made the room dark and the lighting was not adequate enough to compensate for this. I would stay here again IF there was a room where the closing doors on the hall did not make me jump and the mattress was not sagging.

Oct 5 2005	We will definitely stay here again!	My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from 23 - 25 September and couldn't have been happier. Before arrival I contacted the hotel to request a particular room and they couldn't have been more helpful. Our room was spacious, clean and looked like it had been recently refurbished. Yes, it was a little noisy at night but what do you expect when you are just a stones throw from Times Square! At least if you stay up late in Times Square you only have a couple of minutes walk back to your hotel!We are already planning a return trip to New York (which in my opinion is the best city in the world!) and will not hesitate in rebooking the hotel.

Oct 3 2005 	Nice Spot	I was in town for a two day seminar and the host hotel (Westin) was full, so I went searching for a place to stay. Settled on the Comfort Inn for it's location and value. (About half the price of the host hotel, even with the group rate) I obviously was going to give up a few luxuries, but what the heck, I saved the company a few bucks. Review: Negatives-Very small room (Maybe 12 feet by 12 feet) The plumbing from my neighbor was quite loud and woke me up both mornings at about 6 am. Positives-Great value. Outstanding location, just a block from the heart of Times Sqare. Computer office in the lobby for those who do not have a laptop. Continental breakfast. Friendly staff. For the sheer value and location, this is an excellent hotel. Just don't plan to throw a party in your room.

Sep 23 2005	For New York a great value	The Comfort is in an outstanding location if you like action and convenience. The hotel itself is about what you would expect in a budget accommodation. The hotel is located a block and a half from the Rockefeller Center subway station and is easily accessed. We were in 2 different rooms. We had a street facing room for the first night..a little more noisy since the trash pickups show up at 5 am in the front. We requested a room in the back and the staff was able to oblige. Unlike other reviews, we had no problem with the staff. Both rooms, particularly the first, needed to be remodeled....carpet worn and dirty looking....but the rest of the decor was fine and the bathrooms clean. The bottom line is that prices are outrageous in NYC and this is one of the better in the budget category

Sep 2 2005	Beware of this hotel	Due to a family situation I had to cancel my reservation. The manager, Rajni Rikh, refused to give me a cancellation number. Aug 29 2005 	Great Value	The reason I give this hotel 5 circles is because of value. I only spent one night at the Comfort Inn Midtown for business. I was able to get a AAA rate that was very good for midtown Manhattan. The room was clean and the bed relatively comfortable. Location, location, location ... if you want a midtown address without the high rates, this is the choice. Service was good too.

Aug 27 2005	A great choice	My husband and I and our two sons stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from August 22-25. I used this website and relied upon others' reviews when making the booking, as we had never been to NYC before. Everyone was basically right on in their reviews. I thought that since I had used this website to make my decision, I would contribute to it as well to help others. The hotel is not new, nor is it "The Ritz", but it is very clean and the location is perfect. Times Square is such an exciting place to be, and we were steps away from it. We basically walked everywhere, as the hotel is centrally located. The room was small, but we were gone right after breakfast and didn't return until late in the evening, so it wasn't a big deal. The lighting in the room could have been better, the fan in the bathroom wasn't working, we couldn't open a window, and the air conditioner could have been quieter, but these weren't major things. The continental breakfast was okay - nothing spectacular - but it started us off in the morning and allowed us to get on with our day without first having to find a place to eat. There are some good restaurants in the area - we recommended Bubba Gump Shrimp (named for the movie Forrest Gump).Staying at the Comfort Inn Midtown allowed us to make NYC an affordable holiday. It is perfect if you are looking for something clean, well located and affordable at the same time. We loved NYC and had a terrific time. Hope you will, too.

Aug 23 2005	Loved the Comfort Inn Midtown	We spent 2 nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown 8/18/05-8/20/05. It was great. We got there on the 18th at 11:30am, asking to check our bags. Aug 16 2005	Great location!	This hotel is in a great location. Jul 18 2005	You know how to take the reservation but not how to hold the reservation	Long review, but worth reading before you make your reservation...Back in April (2 1/2 months before our arrival date), we reserved two double rooms at the Comfort Inn Midtown for 3 adults and 3 children (reserved on ChoiceHotels). When we arrived at the hotel in July, we were told that there were no double rooms available because the hotel was undergoing renovations. (We didn't see any signs of renovations during our stay.)The front desk clerk offered to put us into two rooms, each with one Queen bed and a cot. We said this would be OK, but only if we were charged the rate that was advertised the previous evening on ChoiceHotels for this room type and date ($55 less per room than the rate we were quoted for our double rooms). He said he could only offer us a 10% discount ($14 less per room). He offered to walk us down the street to another hotel if we didn't want these rooms. We said this was unacceptable since we had to get ready to go see a show in a couple of hours. We then called Choice Hotels Customer Service (CHCS) using the front desk phone.I told the CHCS clerk about what had happened. He asked me if the hotel had offered to pay for our rooms at the other hotel. I told him that they hadn't. He then put my call on hold and contacted the hotel to get more information. The office manager told him that they had one double room available and that they had told us this. When the CHCS clerk came back to my call, he told me this and I informed him that this was not true. I told him I was fine with having only one double room, but only if the single room was at the same discounted rate as listed on the web site the previous evening. He put me on hold and contacted the hotel again and discussed this with the office manager. She spoke loudly and sounded very agitated. After their call, my call with the CHCS clerk was cut off. The office manager said it didn't matter, since the CHCS clerk would just tell me that there was only one double room available and the other room would be only $14 less.Again, I said this was unacceptable and asked her to reconnect me to CHCS. She then told me that they had two double rooms available. She said that we would need to pay $12 extra per person though. We said that we would not pay any extra charges than those on the printed copy of our reservation. She did not seem happy this response, but proceeded to check us in. She said something like "I thought you would have been more understanding, but I guess you don't want to work with me". I thought it was very unprofessional for an office manager to behave this way while other customers were in the lobby, overhearing this entire fiasco.Because our check-in process was so disastrous (about 20 minutes), none of us enjoyed our stay at the hotel. We would definitely warn others not to stay at this hotel, based on our experience, plus other reviews we've read since then. Make sure to check out other reviews with low ratings. Several of them describe very similar stories. There are several other nice hotels in the same area and price range, so make sure to choose your hotel wisely.When we filed a formal complaint with CHCS, we were told that someone in upper management of the hotel would contact us within 7 days. It has been 2 weeks now and we still haven't received a call from anyone at the hotel.

Jul 18 2005	Excellent! Recommend to eveyone	Stayed in the comfort inn midtown, with my boyfriend. Jul 17 2005	STAY AT THIS HOTEL!	OK, I just returned from NYC and the very first thing I am doing is to let everyone know that the previous reviews were right on the mark. We spent three nights here and the place was far and away the best value you will find within miles of Times Square. We (me, wife, 19 y.o., 17 y.o.) stayed in one of their eight double-double rooms. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet, if you don't count the occasional bells of the beautiful church next door! The bathroom was much bigger than expected and the towels were great, despite some previous postings to the contrary. The staff was nothing short of fabulous, especially Dioris and Jovanni behind the counter, and Sidibi and Kenneth, the bellmen. We got there far too early to be checked in, so they took our luggage and stored it securely for us, while we went out and explored. They even pointed out that a festival was going on down on 6th Avenue (away from Times Square) and we should check it out. I know big hotels will do things such as this, but a budget hotel on Times Square? They also knew lots of little secrets and are more than willing to share with you, if you ask.The hallways are incredibly narrow, but also very well-lit. You never once felt as though the place was old and dingy. The elevator was indeed slower than it should be, but with only 80 rooms, we never waited more than a minute or two, and that was rarely. Be careful, though. The elevator door closes so fast that it can smack into you pretty hard if you are not paying attention. Make sure you are holding it with your hand or that someone has the button pushed for you. They have free continental breakfast, which was simply muffins, donuts, cereal, and fruit. But seriously, how much more do you need in NYC? You don't go there to have great breakfasts. We ate quickly and then went out and did what we wanted. The only thing that I will ask them to change when I send in my review to them is to adjust the pressure on the door closers in each room. If you are trying to sleep and the neighbors are not considerate when entering/exiting their room, the door slams shut loudly. The good news is that each hall is divided in half by the elevator shaft, so you really only have about six rooms in your half of the hallway to be disturbed by. They have a computer with internet access in the business center so that those of us who don't want to haul around one on vacation can still check email and weather reports, etc. You can even print out (for free) maps of todays destinations, subways, whatever. Parking was a relative bargain at $20 per day. It is just across the street, about 1/4 block away.I'll sum up by saying this: I will stay in this hotel again the next time I am in NYC. I will not look for a better deal because there is not one to be had.

Jul 10 2005	Worked for us!	We had a very pleasant stay here. I chose this hotel based on the reviews on this site and write-ups in a couple of travel books. Everyone's comments proved to be very accurate. The hotel is 1/2 block east of Times Square directly across the street from the very hip looking Muse Hotel. The street is quiet and we did not have any problems with security. In short, the location can't be beat. Great access to several subway stations gets you wherever you want to go in minutes, theater district is just a few blocks away, Radio City right around the corner, MOMA a couple of blocks past that. Many restaurants are within walking distance. You could walk to Grand Central if you weren't lugging bags. The hotel is very clean, the staff quite pleasant. The wi-fi worked perfectly. Breakfast is included, served in a small room off the lobby, and it is simple (bagels, doughnuts, dry cereals, fruit), but plenty to get you on your way in the morning. This is a small homey-type hotel, the photos on the web site make it look larger than it is. There is a small sitting area and window seat in the lobby, the front desk, a small exercise room, computer room and meeting room. The lobby is very clean and nicely renovated. I believe there are only 8 guest floors, with maybe 12 or so rooms on each floor. There is only one elevator, but we did not experience the excessively long waits that other reviewers have described. Our room was on the 5th floor, and it was an easy walk to take the stairs instead if we wanted. The room itself was quite small, maybe 10x12 feet? with a Queen bed, nightstand, small desk, small armoire with TV. The view out the window was of the brick wall of the next building, it would probably be nicer to choose one of the front rooms if you can. Each room has a window-mounted A/C unit - and this was our biggest complaint, it was very loud when on hi speed, somewhat less noisy when on its lowest setting. The bathroom was relatively large considering the bedroom size, and very nice, tiled all around with a pedestal sink, toilet, tub/shower. The towels are rather thin. Soap and shampoo/conditioner combo are provided, other than that, you'll need to bring your own toiletries.At the end of our stay, we checked out in the morning and checked our bags with the doorman until we were ready to leave later in the afternoon. When we returned to collect the bags, one of the people at the front desk called to me and told me I had left something in my room. I was very pleasantly surprised that she knew me by sight and room number as she handed my camera charger to me.I am normally a more luxury-oriented traveler, so I was concerned about choosing a "value" hotel. If you're the same way, but are willing to forego some of the amenities, this is a great choice. When it came right down to it, we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The breakfast was a nice bonus, the location was fantastic and you can't beat the price -- we were able to happily spend our money instead on fun things like show tickets, etc. -- all in all, it worked great for us. P.S. If you are a AAA member, show your card when you check in. We were given $10 additional off the rate I had already booked with a AAA discount.

Jun 5 2005	Did the job!	When travelling on a budget, particularly to somewhere like Manhattan, it is very easy to find most of your precious dollars swallowed up by accommodation. By staying at the Comfort Inn, my wife and I had more money in our pocket to go out and enjoy the city - which after all, is what it is all about! Our 7-night stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown in May, while having no outstanding features, was comfortable and trouble-free; in other words, it did the job we wanted of it, and it did it admirably!Our expectations of the hotel - and our reasons for choosing it - were based on the reviews here. I guess we expected something a little run-down (but not too much), somewhat noisy at the front, perhaps occasional problems with the cleanliness of the bathrooms or linen. A few reviews suggested that some people found staff to be a little unfriendly or brusque, and that the breakfast provided "ran out" if you weren't there early enough. So we figured that at worst the hotel may be a little unpleasant, but for $130 a night we could live with that.It was a pleasant surprise then, when even our minor apprehensions were proven to be dead wrong. The room was clean and seemed quite new. Despite the fact that we had a 5th floor room at the front (after a check-in request for "something quieter" than the 2nd floor room at the front we were booked in to), we slept soundly through each night without any problems. The towels and bathroom were clean and fresh each day. The breakfast, while a little bland by the 7th morning, was plentiful (though glazed doughnuts for breakfast?!) And most importantly, the staff were out-going and helpful at all times.Best Points:* THE PRICE!* The location - although given the efficiency of the subway, next time I'd be tempted to take an even-cheaper outer boroughs hotel that was next to a subway station.* Room size was much larger than expected - a good 80cm on either side of the queen bed, and at least 1.5m between the foot of the bed and the TV cabinet.* Free internet access - a nice bonus.* Free newspapers at breakfast (if early enough)Not so good points:* No fridge in the room - I guess we assumed there would be one, and had plans to get groceries for lunch and some of our dinners. A fridge can be arranged, but costs an extra $10 per night. No thanks: we ate out.* Slow lift - unless the lift was already at our floor, the only time we waited for it was for luggage. When going down 4 floors, the steps were often faster than the lift.* Toilet often required a couple of flushes, and even blocked once; but was promptly fixed after we asked at reception.But really, these are minor quibbles. None of them produced more than transitory annoyances. For where it was (and compared to the reviews of other Manhattan hotels in the price range), the Comfort Inn Midtown was wonderful.The bottom line: would I stay there again? As I mentioned earlier, better-than-expected public transport would have us looking a little further out next time; but if we stay in Manhattan in future (even when we have a little more to spend) we will be staying at the Comfort Inn Midtown!

Jun 2 2005	Above Average	My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn, Midtown in New York City from May 16 through May 20, 2005. Although the hotel is very small, it was very neat and clean. May 3 2005	Great Hotel	My 11 year old daughter and I stayed here 3 nights in April. We came for a mother daughter getaway. May 2 2005	Very Comfortable At Comfort Inn!!!	What a pleasant surprise this hotel was. Excellent location and a staff better than many found at pricier sites. May 1 2005	Good for the money	For the money this place can't be beat. It is far from perfect but it is clean and very convenient. The staff is friendly and the breakfast adequate (and free). Apr 30 2005	Fantastico Location	I stayed here 11th Nov for 5 nights, i was in NY for a birthday treat with my mother, and after a lot of consideration we chose this hotel.I could not fault it on anything, the rooms were clean, the staff were friendly and the buffet breakfast was fab. Apr 17 2005	Great hotel	I checked trip advisor before booking this hotel for a week in the city. Really glad I did as the reviews are so honest and accurate. Apr 9 2005	Great Location/Non-smoking/Non-smelly	We generally stay at 3 star hotels now. Mar 27 2005	Can't Say a Bad Thing	Well I feel that I owe this hotel and site a review since it was my main source of info on the hotel before my trip. I booked this hotel 3 months ago for a 3 night stay (march 17-20). I got a rate of $107 a night with AAA. But after reading consistent good reviews, I decided to give it a shot. And let me say that I am glad that I did.My mother and I went to NYC and just wanted a place that was clean and in a safe neighborhood. We wanted something centrally located and this hotel couldn't have been in a better location. Just yards away from the heart of Times Square and located near theaters and subways, it couldn't have been better. I requested a room with 2 twin beds and on a corner since I heard they were bigger. I was told that they didn't have corner rooms with twin beds, but when we checked in our room seemed significantly bigger than the other rooms on our floor. Its a buffet with the smallest plates and apalling service.The best restaurant is opposite the comfort inn called Le Tre Veneizie. A good affordable place for lunch.Macys: Busy and hot but good bargians: Go to the Visitor counter, show a passport and you get a card giving 11% everything in the store including sale items.For dinner get a cab to Greenwich Village or Little Italy. Mar 5 2005	Wonderful hotel!	What a great place to stay, plain and simple!My girlfriend and I just got back from a 5-night vacation in New York City, and we had stayed at this location. We went there because of price and the positive reviews on this site. I knew that I wanted to minimize my costs in NY while staying at a decent hotel, so this place fit the bill. So, let's get on with this review, and I'll try to detail it as well as possible, since I just got back from there today (it's still fresh in my mind).The lobby area is elegant enough. Nice marble floors give way to the concierge and the dining room, which is used for the abundant breakfast items (nothing fancy, but there are bagels, doughnuts, apples, bananas, various cereals, strawberry yoghurt, and coffee... I'm not sure if I'm missing anything, since I ate there 2 of the 5 nights there only...) There is a small exercise room up the hall a bit, with a treadmill, a bicycle machine, and I believe a stairmaster. Overall, good lobby amenities. Nothing out of the ordinary, but what is there, it's done well.We stayed on the second floor in the back. The view was nothing to write home about, simply facing a brick wall. Beware, as very little light comes through the black-out curtains and the brick walls. We wanted to wake up early and go sight-seeing, but since no real amounts of light made it into the room, we had a hard time getting up, since we were so comfortable and lazy in our cozy bed. Of course, that does ensure that you get a good night's rest, as there is very little noise and light that comes into your room!The room ameneties are excellent for what they are. Quite a large, decent TV, with about 35 channels. A comfortable, queen-size bed. A nice chair and table. Drawers. A beautiful painting hung over the bed. Just little things that you can find in every hotel, and done well here as well. The furniture, as far as I can tell however, was not run down or did not seem that it would break in an instant, a good sign. The bathroom was excellent, having a shower stall and a modern-looking basin. There is a hair dryer in there as well. Water from the shower was good, cold and hot, and the pressure was good.The rooms were kept spotless, which I was thankful for. Clean towels every day. Clean sheets every day. Amenities replaced as needed, such as new soap bars. Vacuumed every day. It was wonderful, because I cannot live without cleanliness. I've heard horror stories about some other hotels, and I'm glad this isn't one of them.The cleaning lady was one of the sweetest lady I've ever met. You'll know her when you see her. She is so sweet, in that little accent of hers, telling us when our room would be ready again, and always greeting us warmly whenever she saw us. This was a nice touch, especially when you meet lots of people in the city who are too rushed or care too little for niceties. This warmthness also extended to some of the staff members, but she was definitely the person that stuck out in my head. Oh, and so is the guy who encourages you to eat breakfast heartily. He just keeps encouraging to take food! He was also a nice guy.Staff at the front were friendly and helpful for the one time I asked for help, and that was how to take the subway to get to the airport. So I can't really comment on that. They seemed generally friendly though, always ready to answer questions that you had.Overall, a great value hotel. Clean rooms are important to me, and this had them. Oh yes, and there was plenty of space to move freely around the room. It's not a big room, but it's a big-enough room to be comfortable enough. I loved it here, and will most definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

Feb 28 2005	Excellent do not hesitate to book if you're budgeting!	I used this website for guidance before booking the hotel, so I feel that it's only fair to post my opinions here!Simple as this: If you're doing New York on a low to mid-size budget, you simply cannot go wrong with this hotel. The location is perfect - a 20 yard stroll and you're in Times Square. It's in a great position for all of the main attractions (Empire State, Guggenheim, Central Park and all the main shopping districts are within 10 minutes walk) and conveniently placed for the subway to other areas. There's an excellent choice of Deli's and restaraunts around the hotel (Check out the Guinness in the Irish bar next door!)As for the hotel....well, It's pretty good, even aside from the location. Yes, the rooms are small. But what do you expect for $99 per night - a butler?! The bed was very comfortable, the shower was hot and it was clean, tidy and pleasant. Internet access was free downstairs and there was a small selection of exercise machines downstairs (No-one mentioned this!!!)The breakfast is a big bonus. There are doughnuts, bagels, rolls, fruit, yogurt, cereals and tea\coffee, apple and orange juice. I don't know what people are complaining about - there's loads, I found the service friendly and it was the perfect way to start the day. Not many New York hotels offer breakfast, it's a real benefit.Staff are friendly, helpful and polite. We were able to check in an hour early, and they kept our bags for us on the day we checked out.Look, there is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. If you want the lap of luxury - sure, there's much better hotels. But you will pay for them - and how!!! For the price, this is perfect, you will not go wrong.I scoured every review on here before I booked, and was naturally suspicious of all the praise being heaped on what was a very cheap hotel. There is no need to be. Everything people say is true, and you cannot go wrong with this place if you are budgeting!!!!Save $100 per night and spend it on shopping!!!!!!

Feb 15 2005	Perfect place to stay	Me and my daugther stayed here for four nights in February, and I must say this was a perfect choice. Not only for the location, but the hotel itself. Free coffee whenever we wanted all day. All in all, I think this hotel gives great value for the money (which for us was 100 dollar per night plus taxes) with of course unbeatable location really close to Times Square. I really can recommend this hotel to anyone coming to New York. I have stayed in other hotels in New York but this was by far the best value for money.

Feb 14 2005	great price and location	the hotel, while small, gives an european air upon arrival. Feb 6 2005	A gem I'm glad I found	My first time at this hotel but it won't be the last. The satff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, comfortable and warm with a great bathroom fitted with a super shower. The hotel's location on 46th Street location couldn't be better - Times square and subway station at the end of the street, less than a minute's walk away. Restaurants aboud in the area. Value for money, this hotel can't be beaten and I'll certainly be using it again.

Jan 27 2005	Great Value for money.	I booked in to this hotel because of its reviews on Trip Advisor.We (boyf+I) for 10 nights, 11 jan to 21st Jan. Rooms spotlessly clean. Jan 26 2005	Comfort Inn great price...which counts for a lot.	Stayed for 3 nights this week just past. Jan 26 2005	Couldn't ask for more	Would highly recommend this hotel, stayed for 4 nights. We were lucky enough to get a corner room which was bigger than the others. Jan 16 2005	Great value but with compromises	The location is superb. The rooms are clean, and spacious for NYC standards. Jan 11 2005	Great Location 	We stayed at this hotel from January 5 to January 10, 2005. Overall, we found it to be a good place to stay in midtown Manhattan. The breakfast alone could easily cost you $10.00 each in a local eatery. (Try to get the breakfast table by the window to watch the action across the street on W. 46th St., including the Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis High School and people coming and going from The Muse Hotel, where they are paying two or three times the amount you are. It makes the breakfast taste that much better.) There is only one elevator in this nine-floor building, which can be slow. But, if you are on one of the lower floors, the stairs are easy to navigate. Our only complaints related to: noise (surprisingly, from inside the hotel, not from the outside action - the rooms are not very well soundproofed and the room doors bang very loudly, especially at 2 a.m. when the nightclubbers return) and the layout of our room (as it was small, the television was against a side wall, resulting in a literal pain in the neck). Is this a five-star hotel? No. Did we find it to be excellent value in a city where you likely won't spend much time in your room? A definite yes. (If only they could fix those slamming doors!)

Dec 29 2004	Very clean great location good rate	This hotel provided more than we expected. The room was about 10 by 15, plenty large enough for sleeping, and was very clean. Nov 30 2004	Pleasant room but very noisy	I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for twelve nights in October. The hotel is pleasant enough, in a perfect location, but I found my front-facing room looking on to 46th Street extremely noisy. At all hours of the day and night, garbage trucks would pull up a few doors down the street and stand there for up to an hour, grinding refuse. Fortunately I'd brought ear plugs, which came in very handy when I was regularly woken at 3 or 4 in the morning. There was also a permanent roaring, whooshing sound coming from outside - possibly from a big airconditioning unit on a building opposite. On the plus side, the room was spacious, and definitely nicer than the quieter but smaller and stuffier rooms at the back of the hotel, which look directly on to a brick wall, so I decided to rather put up with the noise.The breakfast that was included in the price was also a plus, as was the unlimited internet access available in the little computer room off the lobby. I also enjoyed having a coffee-maker and hairdryer in the room.However, on my next visit to NYC, I'll probably go back to the Portland Square Hotel where I've always stayed before. It's round the corner on 47th Street, so the location is just as perfect, and the price is far less - $105 for a standard double ensuite, compared with $162 at the Comfort Inn. I've always asked for a street-facing room there and have never had a probem with noise, and at least you can open the windows and get a breath of fresh air, which you can't do at the Comfort Inn. The rooms might be a bit more worn-looking, but are spotlessly clean with towels and linen being changed daily, and the bathroom pristine, with all the usual toiletries provided. There is also air-conditioning, cable TV and an in-room safe - very handy. No, breakfast is not included, but one can get a cheap, delicious breakfast at the Evergreen Diner right across the street, so that's not a problem. There is also no in-room coffee-maker, but I always carry my own little immersion heater, so once again, not a problem. All in all, I have yet to discover a better deal in New York City, than the Portland Square Hotel, for value for money

While they may have thicker towels, and plusher carpet, their rooms are no bigger.Re: other concerns: the people we met in the hotel were really nice, the staff friendly, efficient and courteous, the elevator, although only one, came quickly, and the shower had great water pressure.The ac had a timer setting, and the tv had cable. Other things like a coffee maker, ice bucket, etc., were all stock amenities in the room. The ONLY downside was the not-so-thick towels, but I could live with that!Also, parking down the street that the Comfort Inn recommends and stamps for, is a bargain in NYC.Don't forget to ask for your AAA discount!

Sep 8 2004	Terrific Small Hotel	I read about the Comfort Inn Midtown on the Trip Advisor web site. It had received excellent reviews.We were not disappointed. It reminded me of anEnglish Bed and Breakfast Inn. The rooms were spotless, staff friendly and helpful, complimentary breadfast was all one could eat, the room was quiet, location of hotel near Times Square is perfect for theatre goers. The only noise we heard was the morning chiming of church bells next door.The room rate is reasonable. Also appreciated the in-room coffe-maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. The other guests were congenial.Yes, I will stay there on my next trip to New York City.

Aug 28 2004	Took a chance	I had checked and double checked all the tripadvisor comments and took the chance on this hotel. I had never stayed in a hotel in NYC before so I was not sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms were small in comparison to what I have been used to in Chicago or Dallas, etc. but, that is what I had heard would be the case. I was very pleased with the cleanliness. My sheets were as white as snow and crisp. The bathroom was spotless. Oh, and our showerhead broke and was fixed immediately, the staff was very helpful with this glitch. This hotel is close to all the sights. We walked to The Empire State Blg., the shows, NBC, Fox and Friends, Rockafeller Center, Stores, St. Patrick's Cathederal. The breakfast offered from this hotel was a bonus each morning. Yes, the elevator is slow...and there is only one but if you are up for the stairs, they are clean and safe. I was with my 13 year old daughter and the room was sufficent in size for us (1 Q bed) but would not be for someone traveling with a family. I am not sure if they have larger accomodations in the hotel but what we had would not work for a family. Only two people would be comfortable in this size room. I would also suggest to any sight-seers to spend the money for the Hop on Hop Off Grayline New York Sight Seeing Double Decker Bus tours. We spent $72 for The Essential New York which gets you in to The Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, The Seaport Museum (where the Concord is on display), Ticket to the United Nations, and a night tour of Brooklyn via a safe bus ride. This was the best decision I have made. We went to the front of the line for all sites and we were able to SEE everything from a great vantage point on top of the double decker bus. The tour guides are very knowledgeable about NY from the Revolutionary War time to present. Jumping off when you want to visit Battery Park or grab a slice of pizza pie was wonderful. Another bus picks you up from the same dropoff point in twenty minutes to go somewhere else!I would stay at Midtown Comfort Inn again if I visited NY, the price was more than reasonable, the rooms were very, very clean, breakfast was great and we were in the heart of everything that makes NYC, New York! The Irish Pub next door was a fabulous establishment too, fabulous food and great Irish Cider!

Aug 26 2004	You Can't Beat this Hotel	We spent 5 nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Very clean rooms and public areas. Helpful, courteous staff, great rates and location. Nice complementary breakfast. Have been to NYC several times and I have never been more satisfied with a hotel.

Aug 16 2004	Great value	Clean, spacious rooms with a helpful staff. I didn't expect much for under $100, but this place was perfect for a quick trip to the city when all we would do at the hotel was sleep. It's not fancy with lots of frills -- but is all that you need and in the heart of Midtown.

Aug 12 2004	Good reasonably priced hotel near Times Square	We stayed on the Comfort Inn (3  9 Aug) on recommendations found on this and other review sites. It was a good hotel at a reasonable price, but as we came from the UK we didn't qualify for any discounts. The check-in was quick and staff were generally friendly and helpful. On check-in we asked for a quiet room and were told that if we wanted a quiet room it would be small. It certainly was small, but as we were only 2 it was bearable. And it was quiet as long as you didnt switch on the air conditioning. I thought I might get used to it, but after 3 nights I still couldnt sleep well because of the noise. Luckily it wasnt too hot after that, so we just left it switched off at night. Otherwise the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was not much of a view, but I wasnt expecting any at this price. Bathroom was also small and clean. There was no safe in the room, but you can use one at reception at no extra cost. The lift was not fast, but Id seen slower. I didnt find it a big problem and we were staying on the 9th floor. The breakfast was o.k. (bagels, toast, donuts), but it was always busy in the tiny breakfast room. So you couldnt relax, we just ate quickly and got out. Location was great, if you want to stay near Times Square. It was also close to several subway stations, so getting around was no problem. Most restaurants in this area are overpriced and not very good. However, we liked Via Brasil and especially Trattoria Trecolori where we had one of the best Italian meals ever. I recommend this hotel to first time visitors to New York. However, the crowds of tourists in that area got on my nerves a bit after a few days, so I probably would stay in a different neighbourhood next time.

Aug 11 2004	Great room and location	I stayed here for several weekdays in June, 2004. I was very satisfied with the size of the room, cleanliness, and the friendliness of the staff. Aug 9 2004	Great hotel..will stay here again!	I did so much research before booking this hotel. I stayed for a weekend in June and I had a great time. I really loved it and it was great for the price. I would definitely stay here again!

Aug 9 2004	Great place to stay	Great location, just steps from theaters, restaurants and the subway. Aug 3 2004	Perfect place for your first trip to NY	My mom and I traveled to New York for the first time and found the Comfort Inn to be perfect for us. Jul 29 2004	Good People -Great Location!	Great hotel at a great location. The staff and service was excellent and the continental breakfast adequate. Jul 29 2004	Small no-frills hotel--perfect location!	My wife and I stayed five nights here in last week of June, paying $125/night (U.S.) with AAA discount. The hotel is very small and has few amenities but its location more than makes up for it. It's a perfect launching pad for exploring the city, especially if youre up for walking and taking buses and trains. Its a 2-minute walk from Times square, a 10-minute walk from Rockefeller Center and about the same to the 42nd Street subway. (By the way, be prepared for a variety of added NYC taxes on your final hotel bill!)I was on my guard regarding what the hotel would be like, after reading all the various reviews of NYC hotels. But its all about expectations. Expect less and youll be satisfied with less. Check-in was fine. Hotel lobby was quite nice. Asked about a bigger room at the back and was given 606. Smallish elevator and only one. Room was smaller than most hotels weve stayed in North America, but was larger than the discount rooms we had in Rome and Venice. Bathroom was very small, shower quite small, and very limited counter space at sink. View? Brick walls, pigeons, air conditioners and an alley. (Only rooms on floors 7-9 get an actual view of any kind.) Room included TV, nice firm queen bed, desk, side table, small closet with some hangers, iron, ironing board, and bathroom hair dryer. There were a couple of cigarette burns on the bedspread/blanket. Air conditioner worked great for us with temps around 28C every day. No bugs, room was cleaned every morning, room service supplied extra towels when we asked. Room was very quiet at night.One computer available for free internet usage on main floor. Supposedly Wi-Fi was available in room as well as the high-speed line, but I wasnt able to make it work for my older Mac laptop and the staff weren't able to help. Ice is only available in basement, the biggest inconvenience we faced (which really wasnt a huge deal).Staff were relatively helpful. If you want to be pampered, this is not the hotel for you. They will help take care of you but they generally make guests feel independent. That part of it made me think of a hostel. The bellmen weren't highly enthusiastic but did their job.Simple but very sufficient free breakfast included bagels, donuts, toast, buns, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea, milk, juice.Would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it for budget-conscious couples who will spend most of their day away from the hotel.

Jul 22 2004	Good hotel in Midtown	Just came back from a 3-nite stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Completely satisfied! Hotel is clean, quiet. Staff attentive and responsive (got a bathroom problem fixed in 10 minutes after the call). Excellent location to explore Manhattan.

Jul 22 2004	What a great place for a honeymoon!	My wife and I went to the Comfort Inn for the last half of our honeymoon. We loved the staff. Jul 22 2004	Average hotel fantastic location.	I stayed here for 5 nights in May. The room was small but clean and fairly comfortable. Jul 21 2004	All you need!	Visited in July 2004, Location excellent, rooms clean, staff extremely attentive, hotel quiet. What else do you need? Will stay here again on next visit.

Jul 20 2004	Depends on your needs	I resided at this property a few weeks ago. for two days. I wanted a room close to Times Square that was reasonably priced and clean. I think I would say no UNLESS the rate is very low. There is no view as might be expected. I would say that the best part of the the Comfort Inn Midtown is the staff and the what needs improvement is the quality of the furniture, bedding, carpet etc. It would seem to me that because the rooms are small it would be not as expensive to furnish the rooms with some quality items. I think that people would not mind "small" if it was small but classy and decorated with a somewhat quality items. It would give the place a whole different air of quality which regrettfully it does not have. I'll mention housekeeping may need a little improvement but my toilet situation may have been an isolated thing. Hey, I'm not perfect on my job either but constructive criticism does not hurt.Please do NOT let me discourage you from trying this property. It's probably fine for some but I'm telling the experience I had. All in all...two days was enough for me. I was ready to leave. Was it awful - "NO". Could it use improvement..."YES"

Jul 20 2004	Great stay and staff at Comfort Inn	Have just returned from a five night stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown and found the hotel to be clean,comfortable and the staff helpful in every way. Jun 16 2004	Great Hotel	I just got back from staying one week at the mid-town comfort inn, great two star hotel rooms are nice and clean. Close by everything in New York. I will stay here again. Thanks to tripadvisor.

Mar 31 2004	Excellent Value for NYC	Stayed here from March 17 - 21. This is a great value for a hotel in NYC. We paid $107 per night, which included a fairly substantial continental breakfast. Jan 15 2004	Great Hotel Great Price Fantastic Location	We stayed here the weekend before christmas and had a great stay. Its very convienient for strolling round times square. you can easily walk to Fifth Avenue, Saks etc, Central Park, Rockafella centre and even Macy's. The rooms and batrooms were well presented, with simple, but nice decoration and spotlessly clean. The beds were comfortable. The room were a good size, even by New York standards, but you dont go to New York to sit in your room! Within our party we had 3 rooms, all in different parts, all different and all came up above expectation. All the rooms were quiet, and i certainly didnt hear anyone in the next room. I dont think I have ever stayed in a hotel, where you cant here some noise from the corridor and even that was very minimal and didnt disturb us. Didnt really notice the elevator was slow. Would definately go back. only paid $116.00, which for the standard and the location was amazing.

Jan 13 2004	Don't Be Fooled By The Name	I was very pleased with our stay at the Comfort Inn. Although, not my usual hotel of choice, this was quite a bargain. Jan 12 2004	Pleasantly Surprised!	I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown during the Thanksgiving 2003 holiday. I'd never travelled to the New York area overnight before and was travelling with my mother; therefore, it was imparative to locate a decent and convenient hotel. I searched high and low at every hotel site attempting to find the best I could find at a reasonable rate and with availability. Of course every hotel ever reviewed has a bad review but when I read all of the reviews for this hotel, I felt that the overall comments weren't that bad. (And of course two people can stay at the same hotel at the same time and have two entirely different experiences or I could go to the same place twice and have two totally different experiences, but....)Anyway, we stayed there and it was excellent. We had the room with 2 twin beds which was larger than we expected. There was plenty of room to move around, nice and moderate bathroom and bedroom furniture. Our room was on one side of the hotel; therefore, we did not have the noisey elevator problems. The complementary continental breakfast was very nice along with the attendant that serviced it. The staff was quite helpful with turkey day dinner suggestions with connections so that we didn't have to wait in line, supplying coupons for local attractions, etc. It is an excellent location on 46th street and nice to be off the main street. Only had to walk to the end of our block to view the parade! Our experience was lovely and we plan to stay again this year with the hope and expectation that experience is just the same or better. For our experience, I think we got MORE than we paid for at $135/night with the room, service, location, and the breakfast. It is a 2-star hotel, what do you expect. But we were very pleasantly surprised. AND, yes, the one small, slow elevator took some patience as we once walked up to our 8th floor room!

Jan 11 2004	Great place location rooms etc.	great location, 100 bucks only about 50 yards from the epicenter of times square. Rooms are extremely clean, desk people very polite. Jan 5 2004	Good and Bad	I have both good things and bad things to say about this hotel. Some of the good sides are... 1. Excellent location, extremely convenient 2. Cute and Clean 3. Good price 4. Every door of the rooms gets slammed throughout the day, some doves come and stay at the window every morning around 7am and keep making lots of noises, The church next to the hotel has thier bell ring every 30 min. in the morning, people talk loudly in the very tiny hallway. 2. NO BATH TUB to bathe. we thought this woldn't be a problem, but you'll most likely want to take a bath after much walking, just to get rid of some fatigue. 3. Oct 22 2009 	The Best Week Ever! :)	We (mom, dad, Sister and me) went to new york for 8 days in February to celebrate my dads 50th birthday. The location is excellent as you are situated right by a subway station and you are next to a supermarket and only a 20 minute slow walk to Times square and 10 minutes from 5th avenue! Oct 9 2009 	Pleasant Clean	This was an impromptu weekend getaway to NYC that we booked the night before on Priceline (name your own price). You can definitely hear the subway running underneath, but it wasn't loud enough to be a bother or rouse us from sleep (and I'm a light sleeper). People who checked us in/out were gracious to us even though we were about 10-15 minutes late in checking out. Right next to the subway station. Oct 8 2009 	The perfect NYC hotel for us	After staying in an absolute dive on our last trip to NYC, the Marriot on 92nd was a palace.
